comment: This professor is straight up garbage. Illegible handwriting, terrible lectures, and hard to understand are only SOME of the worst qualities about this class. YOU WILL have to teach yourself the majority of the class and BEWARE of daily quizzes and extremely difficult tests. He has review on the SAME DAY OF THE TEST, so study prior to the test.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: This prof is the worst teacher I have ever had. I took calc 1 and 2 in highschool, and have had a 4.0 for my whole college career and I am struggling to pass the class. Hard tests, NO CURVE, absolutely horrible teacher
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: He is hard to understand and has terrible handwriting. Pro to his class is he does have massive curves and you can make up some of your grade by the in class quizzes and attendance.  Be prepared to self teach a lot of the material.

Straight up the worst teacher I've ever had. His handwriting is illegible which wouldn't be so bad if you could understand a word he's saying. He's not really much help when it comes to questions. You're better off taking the quiz at the beginning of each class then just going home and studying by yourself.

Book required first day of class 1-Question quiz at the beginning of each class 20 to 45 Problems for homework Can't understand him Stands in front of the problem at he works it out Curves each test by around 30 pts Does not post any grades (he will email test grades) Tests are 5 to 9 questions long Takes forever to give back graded tests

How this guy keeps his job as a professor is baffling. Avoid at all costs. You will spend more time and effort trying to understand what he is saying due to his inability to speak clearly. Quiz at the beginning of every class. Tests are hard because you do not learn anything in the lectures. Riding his grade curves may help you pass . . .

I'm sure he is a nice guy outside of class.  But he is a absolutely terrible teacher.  Mumbles, talks fast, stands in FRONT of the board when he solves problems.  Doesn't explain the work he is doing in any detail. No patience for student questions.  Just stay away from this guy.
Wow! Please find someone else to take! Cannot understand what he says, cannot comprehend his writing, mumbles and goes way too fast, I'm dropping this class to find something else.

Cons - illegible handwriting, poor explanations, talks quickly, hard tests, late returns on tests/quizzes (I take my final today and still don't have two out of the four exams back) Pros - Grades with a curve based on overall class performance ( I made a 35 that was curved to an 82.  Guy next to me curved from a 3 to a 69)

I'd been out of Math for 3 years and out of college for a year. This school was new to me and he is who I originally picked for Math to get started back on it. BIG MISTAKE!!! Rambles and you can't understand a word coming out. Doesn't explain the problems he's demonstrating. Seems to pull numbers out of his head. Don't get if you want to be taught!

Not a very good teacher. He gives huge curves for people who do poorly on the tests (like me) and ends up giving sometimes nearly 40 point curves. Might not have learned too much math, but it was a pretty easy A.
DO NOT TAKE! If it is the only time that fits in your schedule wait and take someone else. If you read all these reviews and still take him, then yes I would like fries with that.

As a teacher... Very confusing. He understands the material himself very well, however, he mumbles and doesn't convey information well. Easy class because if you do the homework,  you can understand enough to pass the test due to a massive curve.

Pretty nice guy, and highly intellegent, but terrible teacher. Mumbles too fast, skips steps in explaining, writes illegibly.   SELF TAUGHT CLASS!!!!   Just read book before class, took the quiz/test, then left. Upside is he curves nicely on tests. If your good at math and want easy class, take him.  If you want to learn, go elsewhere.

Had him for Precalculus Fall 2011. I had knowledge of precalculus and so I made an A in the class. You must DO AND UNDERSTAND the homework to do well on the tests. Books is required. he takes up the homework and you have easy 1 problem quiz grades for section. It's a SELF-TAUGHT class. The tests are highly curved but must UNDERSTAND the sections.

If you already have some grasp on the subject from high school or elsewhere, I'd absolutely recommend taking this guy's class, he curves quite nicely (went from a 64 to a 91 on one exam) and he's very lenient on late homework or missed tests. You can leave his class right after the quiz (a question out of the book). Nice guy.

Dont take his class if you dont want to learn on your own. I cant teach, and when you question what he just said. He cant explain it clearly. Homework is from his textbook, he collects it after every quiz, just do some and right down the problem for the rest and you will get an A for hw! Test are so werid cause you can just put the answer, curves!

Talks too fast and mumbles. He fails to explain any steps on how to solve the problem and does most of the work in his head. When writing on the board he ends up writing sideways as well as unreadable.
DO NOT TAKE!

Talks to fast and mumbles. While attempting to give instruction and showing problems he stands in front of it as he writes so you cannot follow along. Give a lot of homework he doesn't grade on correctness just completion. quizzes every day of class.
Horrible, difficult to understand, does not help at all. Give a lot of homework that he doesn't grade. Just show up on time for quizzes and come on test day and teach yourself
Talks to fast, No personality. Wicked hard tests, But curves huge. One qestion quizes tough also. Some people only came for the quizes test and left

Terrible teacher. Mumbles so fast you cannot understand a thing he says. His writing is terrible and so are his explanations. Only reason I did not drop his class is because his quizzes are usually one or two problems from the book and his tests are open book/open notes.

This guy needs to retire. Showed up for the first day of class, talked way too fast, writes illegibly and tiny on the board, doesnt explain where he got formulas from or how he was using them. Dropped the class after one day, encouraged everyone else to do the same. This guy is by far the worst professor I have ever had

TERRIBLE! Needs to be fired or retire, one of the two. First day of Calculus, starts off by writing two formulas down, does not explain anything then proceeds to do examples, again without explaining anything. Whole class didn't know what was going on. Came back the next day 5 people showed up, everyone else dropped the class for another teacher.

I took him twice because he was open note/book tester and knew that if I took someone for my 2nd math class I'd be screwed cuz he didn't teach me anything.  had to figure it out on my own by using the student solutions manual.  Plus attendance wasn't required so another reason to take him.  You must be good a self teaching though!  He's a mumbler!

Get the student solution manual!!!!!  He is an "open notes/open book" tester so I just use the solutions manual to get me a C in one class and a B in the other.  Should not be a teacher!  Self-taught class.  Take him online if you hav chance to.  It would be a waste of drive to campus/gas/time/mind, etc.... to take his class.  Needs to retire!!!!!!

I believe he knows this stuff, but cannot teach it--you have to teach yourself. The only plus to him is that he doesn't require attendance and he curves tests a lot. I feel I would have made a better grade without a curve if I had had a teacher that could teach. There is a lot covered in this class, but that's the case no matter who the teacher is.

I did not understand the class and it was even more difficult having a professor who rushes through material and does not speak clearly. This is a self taught course and I can honestly say his teaching didn't help. I barely passed by self teaching.

SO Boring, Talks like he has marshmallows in his mouth during his lectures BUT not when he's just talking about life. I think HE'S even bored during Math class. He lost like 10 of my roommate's quizzes, LOL! He's HILARIOUS if you think people can be funny without trying to be funny.

This guy is almost incomprehensible (but very entertaining like Rainman). I spend an additional 20 hours a week in order to maintain with the book which is awfully confusing too. HUGE CURVES (45 -> 75) Make sure you understand concepts for CALC II or your screwed!

Nice enough guy. No sense of humor. Easy enough class. Text book required. You will be teaching yourself throughout the entire semester. Most students go to class just to take the quiz, turn in homework and then leave. HW assignments given at beginning of semester. If you're not very good at math and need a good teacher. Don't take Dr. Morris.
Unintelligible, both in his speaking and writing. If you know how to read you can probably teach yourself better than this guy.

took him for Discrete Math, only showed up to class 7 times the entire semester, got an A. If you can read a book and teach yourself then you can get an A cuz his tests are very fair to say the least.

Pretty dorky teacher, but very easy! He gives really easy one-question quizzes every day, and they are worth about 10% of your grade. So they help a lot. HW grades are all up to the TA. He only makes homework 5% of your grade, so if you miss a couple of assignments, don't freak out over it. Attendence is based on the quizzes so it's best 2 be there
Easy class, just do some homework for each section (not all, just a few questions so you know your stuff) and you can pass without attending most of the time.
He is very smart.  talks fast, but just take notes.
He is very helpful. If you do not understand, he will explain again and again until you do, although he talks too fast and it's hard to understand him. He does knows his stuff.
Easy class. I don't even go half of the time, yet still have an A. It's great! He is awesome too, because you can talk him into alot of stuff too. Like taking your tests early.
Talk about boring. The students never even attend his classes. He can bore you to death. Terrible guy
Talks way to fast, However, he knows most of his stuff. Very easy.
